Plotting Class

class ForMoSA.plotting.plotting_class.ComplexRadar(fig, variables, ranges, n_ordinate_levels=6)[source]

Original from Damian Cummins: https://github.com/DamianCummins/statsbomb-football-event-visualisations/blob/master/Statsbomb%20Womens%20World%20Cup%202019%20visualisation.ipynb

Adapted by: P. Palma-Bifani

scale_data(data, ranges)[source]

scales data[1:] to ranges[0]

class ForMoSA.plotting.plotting_class.PlottingForMoSA(config_file_path, color_out)[source]

Here all the plotting functionalities of ForMoSA to see the

Author: Paulina Palma-Bifani

plot_Clouds(cloud_prop, path_cloud_profile, figsize=(6, 5))[source]

Cloud profiles calculations

Inputs: - cloud_prop (str) : choose the cloud

'eddy_diffusion_coefficient', 'vmr_CH4', 'vmr_CO', 'vmr_CO2', 'vmr_FeH', 'vmr_H2O', 'vmr_H2S', 'vmr_HCN', 'vmr_K', 'vmr_Na', 'vmr_NH3', 'vmr_PH3', 'vmr_TiO', 'vmr_VO', 'cloud_opacity_Fe', 'cloud_opacity_Mg2SiO4', 'cloud_particle_radius_Fe', 'cloud_particle_radius_Mg2SiO4', 'cloud_vmr_Fe', 'cloud_vmr_Mg2SiO4'

Return: fig, ax

Author: Nathan Zimniak and Paulina Palma-Bifani

plot_PT(path_temp_profile, figsize=(6, 5), model='ExoREM')[source]

Plot the Pressure-Temperature profiles Calculates the most probable temperature profile

Return: fig, ax

Author: Nathan Zimniak and Paulina Palma-Bifani

plot_fit(figsize=(10, 5), uncert='yes')[source]

Plot the best fit comparing with the data.

Parameters

  • global_params -- Class containing each parameter used in ForMoSA

  • save -- If ='yes' save the figure in a pdf format

Author: Paulina Palma-Bifani
